measured_by: number of misclassifications of the 40/60 tissue-sample trials
justification: “The main dependent variable in our experiment was the number of misclassifications of the ten 40/60 tissue samples… we expected volunteers in the group assisted by the biased AI to misclassify more often….”

measured_by: number of biased classifications of the ambiguous 50/50 stimuli
justification: “We measured an additional dependent variable… the number of times each participant classified the five 50/50 stimuli in the same direction as the bias of the AI… We named this variable as biased classifications.”

topic_or_construct: Trust in AI in the health domain
measured_by: single-item 9-point Likert scale rating (1 = not at all to 9 = completely)
justification: “Volunteers then answered, on a Likert scale from 1 (not at all) to 9 (completely), … their trust in artificial intelligence in the area of health, in general.”

topic_or_construct: Perceived helpfulness of the AI system
justification: “Volunteers then answered… a series of questions about… how helpful they considered the AI of the experiment to be,” referring to the same 1–9 Likert format.
Participants rated “the accuracy they attributed to the AI recommendations in the task” on the 1 (not at all) to 9 (completely) Likert scale.

measured_by: yes/no self-report question on whether they detected any mistakes in the AI advice
justification: “In the present Experiment 2, we added two questions to ask volunteers directly whether they based their answers on the recommendations and whether they detected any errors in the AI recommendations.”
